headline: The Antitrust Case Against Facebook Crumbles
snippet: A federal judge delivered a major blow to those trying to shrink Big Tech.
abstract: A federal judge delivered a major blow to those trying to shrink Big Tech.
byline: By Andrew Ross Sorkin, Jason Karaian, Sarah Kessler, Stephen Gandel, Michael J. de la Merced, Lauren Hirsch and Ephrat Livni

headline: The War on History Is a War on Democracy
snippet: A scholar of totalitarianism argues that new laws restricting the discussion of race in American schools have dire precedents in Europe.
abstract: A scholar of totalitarianism argues that new laws restricting the discussion of race in American schools have dire precedents in Europe.

headline: Red America’s Covid Problem
snippet: David Leonhardt on the growing Covid problem in heavily Republican areas.
abstract: Cases are rising, because of the Delta variant.

headline: The Mike Pence Saga Tells Us More Than We Want to Know
snippet: But he is not the only politician who shows which way the wind is blowing.
abstract: But he is not the only politician who shows which way the wind is blowing.
byline: By Gail Collins and Bret Stephens

headline: Transcript: Ezra Klein Interviews Ari Berman
I Created ‘The X-Files.’ Here’s Why I’m Skeptical of the New U.F.O. Report.
snippet: “Could the government actually be telling the truth? Or is the truth above top secret?” asks “X-Files” creator Chris Carter.
abstract: “Could the government actually be telling the truth? Or is the truth above top secret?” asks “X-Files” creator Chris Carter.

headline: They Seemed Like Democratic Activists. They Were Secretly Conservative Spies.
snippet: Operatives infiltrated progressive groups across the West to try to manipulate politics and reshape the national electoral map. They targeted moderate Republicans, too — anyone seen as threats to hard-line conservatives.
abstract: Operatives infiltrated progressive groups across the West to try to manipulate politics and reshape the national electoral map. They targeted moderate Republicans, too — anyone seen as threats to hard-line conservatives.
byline: By Mark Mazzetti and Adam Goldman

headline: Infrastructure, Surfside, Giuliani: Your Thursday Evening Briefing
snippet: Here’s what you need to know at the end of the day.
abstract: Here’s what you need to know at the end of the day.

headline: Dialogue Is Not Possible With ‘Opposing Views of Reality’
snippet: Readers say today's Republican Party is too extreme to engage with. Also: Britney Spears; military aid to the Saudis; the Tokyo Olympics: moms and work; manicures.
abstract: Readers say today's Republican Party is too extreme to engage with. Also: Britney Spears; military aid to the Saudis; the Tokyo Olympics: moms and work; manicures.

headline: Buffett Weighs In on Tax-Free Philanthropy
snippet: The Berkshire Hathaway chief, who has given away billions, asks whether donations should keep their special status.
abstract: The Berkshire Hathaway chief, who has given away billions, asks whether donations should keep their special status.

headline: OSHA issues a new Covid safety rule, but only for the health care industry.
snippet: The Labor Department says it will issue optional guidance to other employers. Some advocacy groups say more is needed.
abstract: The Labor Department says it will issue optional guidance to other employers. Some advocacy groups say more is needed.
